info.name: VibgyorNode API - Complete Collection (Corrected)

item.name: Catalog Management
item.description:
Catalog management for profile dropdown options.

Catalog Lists (6 total):
1. gender - Gender options
2. pronouns - Pronoun options  
3. likes - User likes/hobbies
4. interests - User interests
5. hereFor - Purpose/intent options (NEW)
6. languages - Language options (NEW)

Access:
- Read: All users
- Create/Update/Delete: Admin/SubAdmin only

request.description:
Get all catalog options for profile setup.

Returns:
- gender: Array of gender options
- pronouns: Array of pronoun options
- likes: Array of like options
- interests: Array of interest options
- hereFor: Array of purpose/intent options (NEW)
- languages: Array of language options (NEW)
- version: Catalog version number

Used in profile completion steps 2-5.
Get gender options from catalog. Returns array of gender options.
Get available languages from catalog. Used for preferences.primaryLanguage and preferences.secondaryLanguage selection.
Get 'here for' options from catalog. Used for preferences.hereFor selection (user intent/purpose).
Create a new catalog with all lists including preferences (hereFor and languages). Only one catalog can exist - use PUT to update.
Update existing catalog with all lists. Increments version number. Can update individual lists or all at once.

Add new items to a specific catalog list.

Valid listTypes:
- gender (genderList)
- pronouns (pronounList)
- likes (likeList)
- interests (interestList)
- hereFor (hereForList) ‚Üê NEW
- languages (languageList) ‚Üê NEW

Examples:
- Add languages: {"listType": "languages", "items": ["Bengali", "Tamil"]}
- Add interests: {"listType": "interests", "items": ["yoga", "art"]}
- Add hereFor: {"listType": "hereFor", "items": ["business", "mentorship"]}

request.description:
Create a new post with text, media, location, and privacy settings.

**Form-Data Fields:**
- content: Post text content (required if no media)
- caption: Post caption/title (optional)
- visibility: public | followers | private (default: public)
- commentVisibility: everyone | followers | none (default: everyone)
- location: JSON string with location details (optional)
  - Example: {"name":"Mumbai","coordinates":{"lat":19.0760,"lng":72.8777},"address":"Mumbai, India","placeId":"...","placeType":"locality","accuracy":"city"}
- hashtags: JSON array of hashtags (optional, auto-extracted from content)
  - Example: ["travel","photography","nature"]
- mentions: JSON array of user IDs to mention (optional, auto-extracted from @username)
  - Example: ["user_id_1","user_id_2"]
- files: Image or video files (optional, max 10MB)

**Location Fields:**
- name: Location name (e.g., "Mumbai", "Eiffel Tower")
- coordinates: {lat: number, lng: number}
- address: Full address string
- placeId: Google Places ID (optional)
- placeType: locality | city | region | point_of_interest | etc.
- accuracy: exact | approximate | city | region | country

**Privacy Options:**
- visibility: Who can see the post
  - public: Everyone can see
  - followers: Only followers can see
  - private: Only you can see
- commentVisibility: Who can comment
  - everyone: Anyone can comment
  - followers: Only followers can comment
  - none: Comments disabled

**Automatic Features:**
- Hashtags (#) are auto-extracted from content
- Mentions (@username) are auto-extracted from content
- Post status is automatically set to 'published'
- Media is uploaded to S3 with optimization

**Response:**
- Returns created post with ID
- Auto-populated POST_ID environment variable

Get all posts created by the current authenticated user.

**Query Parameters:**
- page: Page number (default: 1)
- limit: Results per page (default: 20)

**Returns:**
- Array of user's own posts (published and drafts)
- Each post includes a `lastComment` field showing the newest comment
- Total count
- Pagination metadata

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "posts": [
    {
      "_id": "...",
      "content": "Post content",
      "author": {...},
      "comments": [...],
      "lastComment": {
        "_id": "...",
        "user": {
          "_id": "...",
          "username": "john_doe",
          "fullName": "John Doe",
          "profilePictureUrl": "..."
        },
        "content": "Latest comment text",
        "createdAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.000Z"
      },
      "likesCount": 10,
      "commentsCount": 5
    }
  ]
}
```

Get all posts from a specific user.

**Path Parameters:**
- userId: ID of the user whose posts to retrieve

**Query Parameters:**
- page: Page number (default: 1)
- limit: Results per page (default: 20)

**Returns:**
- Array of user's published posts
- Each post includes a `lastComment` field showing the newest comment
- Total count
- Pagination metadata

**Note:** Only shows published posts unless viewing your own profile.

Get a single post by ID with full details.

**Path Parameters:**
- postId: ID of the post to retrieve

**Returns:**
- Full post details with populated author, comments, and likes
- `lastComment` field showing the newest comment
- View count (incremented if not the author)

**Response Structure:**
```json
{
  "_id": "...",
  "content": "Post content",
  "author": {
    "_id": "...",
    "username": "john_doe",
    "fullName": "John Doe",
    "profilePictureUrl": "...",
    "isVerified": true
  },
  "comments": [...],
  "lastComment": {
    "_id": "...",
    "user": {
      "_id": "...",
      "username": "jane_doe",
      "fullName": "Jane Doe",
      "profilePictureUrl": "..."
    },
    "content": "Latest comment text",
    "createdAt": "2024-01-15T10:30:00.000Z"
  },
  "likes": [...],
  "likesCount": 10,
  "commentsCount": 5,
  "viewsCount": 100,
  "visibility": "public",
  "location": {...}
}
```

**Privacy Checks:**
- Private posts: Only author can view
- Followers-only posts: Author + followers can view
- Public posts: Everyone can view

Update post content, visibility, comment settings, and location.

**Body Fields:**
- content: Post text content (optional)
- visibility: public | followers | private (optional)
- commentVisibility: everyone | followers | none (optional)
- location: Location object with coordinates and place details (optional)
  - name: Location name (e.g., "Mumbai")
  - coordinates: { lat: number, lng: number }
  - address: Full address string
  - placeId: Google Places ID
  - placeType: locality, city, region, etc.
  - accuracy: exact | approximate | city | region | country

**Note:** All fields are optional. Only provided fields will be updated.

Archive a post. Archived posts are hidden from feed and profile but can be unarchived later.

**Path Parameters:**
- postId: ID of the post to archive

**Response:**
- Updated post with isArchived: true

**Note:** Only the post author can archive their posts.

Unarchive a previously archived post. The post will be visible again in feed and profile.

**Path Parameters:**
- postId: ID of the post to unarchive

**Response:**
- Updated post with isArchived: false

**Note:** Only the post author can unarchive their posts.

Save a post to your saved collection for later viewing.

**Path Parameters:**
- postId: ID of the post to save

**Response:**
- Success message
- Updated saved posts count

**Note:** Can save any public post or posts from users you follow.

Remove a post from your saved collection.

**Path Parameters:**
- postId: ID of the post to unsave

**Response:**
- Success message
- Updated saved posts count

Get all posts saved by the current user.

**Query Parameters:**
- page: Page number (default: 1)
- limit: Results per page (default: 20)

**Returns:**
- Array of saved posts
- Total count
- Pagination metadata
- Date saved for each post

item.name: Stories Management (Simplified)
item.description:
Simplified Stories API - 9 endpoints for ephemeral content sharing.

Features:
‚úì Image/Video/Text stories (max 10MB media, 2200 chars text)
‚úì Privacy controls (public/followers/close_friends)
‚úì @mentions auto-detection
‚úì View tracking (silent, no notifications)
‚úì Replies (DM or public, max 200 chars)
‚úì Reporting system (auto-flag at 3+ reports)
‚úì Analytics (views, replies, shares, engagement rate)
‚úì Hashtag search
‚úì Auto-expiration (24 hours)
‚úì Content moderation (AI + manual review)

Removed:
‚úó Reactions, Polls, Questions, Music, Countdown
‚úó Location tagging, Filters, Stickers
‚úó Story Highlights
‚úó Reach & Impressions metrics
‚úó Notifications

formdata.description: Media files (image/video) - optional if content provided
Text content (max 2200 chars) - optional if files provided

request.description:
Create a story with image, video, or text. Supports @mentions in content. Auto-expires in 24 hours.

Validations:
- Content OR media required (at least one)
- Content max 2200 characters
- Media max 10MB
- Supported formats: image (jpeg, png, webp, gif), video (mp4, mov, avi)

Response includes story object with auto-generated expiry time (24h from creation).
Get stories from followed users grouped by author. Privacy-filtered based on relationships (public/followers/close_friends). Stories auto-expire after 24 hours.

query.description: Include expired stories (default: false, auto true for own stories)

request.description: Get all stories from a specific user. If viewing own stories, expired stories are automatically included regardless of the includeExpired parameter.

Get a specific story. Automatically tracks view if not the author (no notifications sent).

Behavior:
- Increments view count for unique users
- Checks privacy settings (public/followers/close_friends)
- Returns 400 if story expired
- Returns 403 if private and user not authorized

Response includes story with mentions populated (username, fullName, profilePictureUrl).
Delete a story (only author can delete). Soft deletes and removes media from S3.

Reply to a story. Max 200 characters. Can be sent as DM (default) or public.

Validations:
- Content required (cannot be empty)
- Max 200 characters
- Story must not be expired

Response includes updated replies array and repliesCount.

Report a story for policy violations.

Valid Reasons:
- spam
- inappropriate
- harassment
- fake_news
- violence
- other

Validations:
- Reason required
- Description max 500 characters
- Cannot report same story twice

Behavior:
- 3+ reports automatically flag for admin review
- Content moderation record updated

Get detailed story analytics. Only the story author can view analytics.

Returns:
- views: Total unique views
- replies: Total replies count
- shares: Total shares count
- engagementRate: (replies / views) √ó 100
- timeRemaining: Seconds until expiration
- createdAt: Story creation timestamp
- expiresAt: Story expiration timestamp (24h after creation)

Error:
- 403: Not the author
- 404: Story not found
Search public stories by hashtag (without # symbol in URL path). Only returns active, non-expired, public stories. Replace 'nature' in path with desired hashtag.
Get all public posts when no search keyword is provided. This is the default explore/discovery feed.
Search across all categories (people, posts, hashtags, location) with a keyword.
Search for people by name or username. Excludes blocked users and inactive accounts.
When no keyword is provided for people search, returns empty results.
Search posts by content, caption, hashtags, location, or mentions. Only shows public posts.
When no keyword is provided, returns all public posts (explore feed).
Search posts by hashtags. Can include # symbol or just the hashtag name.
Search posts by location (name, address, city, or country).
Use filter parameter to search only in people category.
Use filter parameter to search only in posts category.
